title: As India investigates deadly train crash, critics raise safety concerns
description: Railway officials said the investigation was ongoing but that early reports indicated problems with signals on the tracks.

title: U.S. and China lock horns at Asia’s top security forum
description: Though the U.S. and Chinese defense ministers both stressed a desire to avoid conflict, tensions between the two powers shadowed all discussions at the Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore.

title: China, U.S. trade barbs over Taiwan after Beijing refuses private talks
description: The U.S. and Chinese defense ministers, Lloyd Austin and Li Shangfu, traded accusations at the Shangri-La Dialogue, undercutting efforts for a diplomatic thaw.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Child killed, more than 20 injured in Dnipro blast
description: Ukrainian officials said the Russian attack left at least 20 people wounded. Protests are planned in Russia for detained opposition leader Alexei Navalny's birthday.

title: Taliban moving senior officials to Kandahar. Will it mean a harder line?
description: The remote Afghan city, the Taliban's spiritual center, is hosting more regime officials and foreign dignitaries as Mullah Hibatullah Akhundzada consolidates power.

title: NATO-trained units will serve as tip of spear in Ukraine’s counteroffensive
description: The counteroffensive will be the biggest test yet of the U.S.-led strategy of giving the Ukrainians weapons and training to fight like an American army might — but on their own.

title: He’s leading Mexico’s probe of the Dirty War. Who’s spying on him?
description: Pegasus spyware has been detected in the phone of the government’s top investigator into the military’s Cold War-era abuses. Now Mexico’s president faces a defining moment.

title: Thomas Buergenthal, Holocaust survivor who shaped global rights law, dies at 89
description: Dr. Buergenthal was part of cases ranging from Israel's separation barrier to atrocities in Central America.
